sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Kerch Bridge is both symbolic to the Kremlin and a key route for Moscow to sustain its forces in the southern part of Ukraine, including ferrying supplies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.sentence: Ukrainian troops have continued to regain ground in their counteroffensive that began last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But several explosions took Kharkiv, Ukraine's second-largest city, early Saturday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And Russian forces seem to be gaining momentum in the Ukraine-controlled industrial town Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The town has been under Russian shelling for weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And volunteers are rushing to help some of its elderly get to safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This week alone, our soldiers liberated from the Russian pseudo-referendum area 776 square kilometers of territory in the east of our country and 29 settlements, including six in Luhansk region.

The war is also deepening Ukraine's humanitarian crisis. Many localities are lacking even the most basic services. The International Monetary Fund has announced it will provide the country over 1 billion euros in support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Desperate residents line up for aid in Ukraine, as many of the people in the Kharkiv region are now almost entirely dependent on humanitarian aid.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Around half of the population in the retaken areas, which account for more than 73,000 people, have received food assistance, according to the UN. No town better represents the struggle for survival than Issyum.

sentences.sentence: And they have limited access to electricity, gas, water, food and medical services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN's top human rights body has voted to appoint a monitor to scrutinize reported rights abuses in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The measure was approved by the 47-member UN Human Rights Council in Geneva.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's the first time a rapporteur has been appointed to investigate rights issues in a permanent member of the Security Council.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: For years we've been witnessing a steady deterioration in the human rights situation in the Russian Federation, which has accelerated in recent months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Recent draconian laws aimed at stifling independent media and undesirable organizations, harsh sanctions for anyone who questions the government, or the large number of people arrested in connection with demonstrations are some recent examples of a systematic policy of repression. Since Russia invaded Ukraine thousands of people have been detained for protesting against the war and the recent partial mobilization mandate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The UN vote came shortly after the Russian Rights Group Memorial became a joint winner of the Nobel Peace Prize.

sentences.sentence: Incumbent Austrian President Alexander Van der Bellen wrapped up a low-profile re-election campaign this Friday.

sentences.sentence: Van der Bellen has the backing of major parties in Austria, as well as celebrities such as Arnold Schwarzenegger.

sentences.sentence: I can't tell Austrians who to vote for, but I'm going to vote for you 100%.
